name: verbose_level
longdoc:
Verbosity level for information logging

0: Only errors
1: Warning
2: Information
3: Debug

name: data_type
longdoc: Reconstruction floating number precision ('single' or 'double')

name: base_dir
shortdoc: Relative base path for all other paths
longdoc: Important: any otherpath that not have a leading '/' indicating an absolut path will be consideres as having base_dir as root

name: run
longdoc: If None, the filename of the reconstruction script will be used

name: data_dir
shortdoc: directory where diffraction data is stored
longdoc: (deprecated)

name: plot_dir
longdoc: probably this parameter will shift to the plotting client later

name: plot_file
longdoc: Filename generation will have acces to `runtime` dictionary and may use the values stored there

name: dump_dir
longdoc: DUMPING IST NOT IMPLEMENTED YET. Be aware that dumping that dumping intermediate results from reconstruction process may result in significant performance decrease due to IO-delay

name: source
shortdoc: Address or path to data ressource.
longdoc: A path will be prefixed by `data_dir` if not having a leading '/'. Use right click for a file finding dialog box. If data source is 'sim' the file does not need to exist but will be created during simulation. Be careful, any selected file of the same name will be overwritten. (NOTE) For automatic reconstruction of many scans, a list of file paths may be used here if this parameter is a child of model.

name: tags
shortdoc: tags (comma seperated) describing what kind of data this is
longdoc: 'stream' (not yet implemented). Provide an address in `source` which must be accesible from and interactor::client. 'sim' tag will make this data simulated using additional parameters from `simulation` container. 'empty' tag means that this data has a flat (empty) object

name: geometry
shortdoc: define physical constants of your experiment here

name: scan_type
longdoc: if None, positions are read from meta data on load

name: nr
shortdoc: round : number of intervals (# of shells - 1)

name: nth
shortdoc: round,round_roi: number of points in the first shell

name: nx
shortdoc: raster scan: number of steps in x

name: ny
shortdoc: raster scan: number of steps in y

name: incoming
shortdoc: `None`, path to a file or any python evaluable statement yielding a 2d numpy array. If `None` defaults to array of ones

name: phase_noise_rms
shortdoc: phase noise amplitude on incoming wave before aperture

name: phase_noise_mfs
shortdoc: phase noise minimum feature size on incoming wave before aperture

name: prop_dist
shortdoc: focus: propagation distance (meter) from focus. parallel: propagation distance (meter) from aperture

name: UseConjugate
shortdoc: use the conjugate of the probe instef of the probe
longdoc: this parameter is of limited use. maybe gets deprecated

name: antialiasing
shortdoc: antialiasing factor used when generating the probe

name: spot_size
longdoc: if aperture_size = None this parameter is used instead to calculate the appropriate aperture size in foruier domain. If spot_size = None, a spot size of 50 pixels will be used

name: probe
longdoc: assign a numpy array here to override the complete probe creation procedure

name: source
shortdoc: 'diffraction', None, path to a file or nd-array
longdoc: by default it is assumed that a source only has a single channel of information

name: offset
shortdoc: offset between center of object array and scan pattern

name: zoom
longdoc: If None, the pixel is assumed to be right otherwise the image will be resized using ndimage.zoom

name: density
longdoc: only used if formula is not None

name: thickness
longdoc: if None, the absolute values of loaded source array will be used

name: ref_index
longdoc: If None, treat source array as projection of refractive index. If a refractive index is provided the array's absolut value will be used to scale the refractive index.

name: smoothing_mfs
shortdoc: smooth the projection with gaussian kernel of with x pixels

name: noise_rms
shortdoc: noise applied, relative to 2*pi in phase and relative to 1 in amplitude

name: fill
shortdoc: if object is smaller than the objectframe, fill with fill

name: scan_per_probe
longdoc: a number smaller than 1 means that the respective scan is split among the inverse number of probes

name: scan_per_object
longdoc: a number smaller than 1 means that the respective scan is split among the inverse number of objects

name: object_shared_with
shortdoc: `scan_label` of scan for the shared obejct
longdoc: This parameter overrides `scan_per_object`

name: object_share_power
longdoc: 0 means that this scan will not update the shared probe

name: probe_shared_with
shortdoc: `scan_label` of scan for the shared probe
longdoc: This parameter overrides `scan_per_probe`

name: probe_share_power
longdoc: 0 means that this scan will not update the shared probe

name: scans
shortdoc: empty structure to be filled with scna specific content

name: data
longdoc: bla

name: engine
longdoc: 42 it is!

name: numiter_contiguous
shortdoc: Number of iterations to be executed in one go

name: probe_support
shortdoc: Fraction of valid probe area (circular) in probe frame

name: probe_inertia
shortdoc: Probe fraction kept from iteration to iteration

name: object_inertia
shortdoc: Object fraction kept from iteration to iteration

name: obj_smooth_std
shortdoc: Gaussian smoothing (pixel) of kept object fraction

name: clip_object
shortdoc: Clip object amplitude into this intrervall

name: probe_update_start
shortdoc: Number of iterations before probe update starts

name: update_object_first
shortdoc: If False update object before probe

name: overlap_converge_factor
shortdoc: Loop overlap constraint until probe change is smaller than this fraction

name: overlap_max_iterations
shortdoc: Maximum iterations to be spent inoverlap constraint

name: fourier_relax_factor
shortdoc: If rms of model vs diffraction data is smaller than this fraction, Fourier constraint is met
longdoc: Set this value higher for noise data

name: floating_intensities
shortdoc: If True, allow for adaptative rescaling of the diffraction pattern intensities (to correct for incident beam intensity fluctuations).

name: intensity_renormalization
shortdoc: A rescaling of the intensity so they can be interpreted as Poisson counts.

name: reg_del2
shortdoc: Whether to use a Gaussian prior (smoothing) regularizer.

name: reg_del2_amplitude
shortdoc: Amplitude of the Gaussian prior if used.

name: smooth_gradient
shortdoc: Smoothing preconditioner. If 0, not used, if > 0 gaussian filter if < 0 Hann window.

name: scale_precond
shortdoc: Whether to use the object/probe scaling preconditioner.
longdoc: Set this value higher for noise data

name: scale_probe_object
shortdoc: the relative scale of probe and object.
longdoc: Set this value higher for noise data

name: probe_update_start
shortdoc: Number of iterations before probe update starts

name: engines
shortdoc: empty structure to be filled with engines
longdoc: 42 it is!

name: simulation
longdoc: If any scan's data source is named 'sim' us this Param as Basis for a simulation

name: antialiasing
shortdoc: use antialiasing when generating diffraction paterns
